content:
That's great to hear that you've found a new yoga studio near your apartment and you're enjoying it! Restorative yoga is a wonderful style of yoga that can be very beneficial for relaxation and rejuvenation.

There are many online resources that offer restorative yoga classes, here are a few recommendations:

Websites:

1. **YogaGlo**: YogaGlo has a vast library of restorative yoga classes, with classes ranging from 30 minutes to 1 hour. They offer a free trial period, and then it's $18/month.
2. **DoYouYoga**: DoYouYoga has a dedicated section for restorative yoga classes, with classes led by experienced teachers. They offer a free trial period, and then it's $15/month.
3. **Gaia**: Gaia is a yoga and meditation platform that offers a variety of restorative yoga classes, including classes specifically designed for stress relief, sleep, and relaxation. They offer a free trial period, and then it's $11.99/month.

YouTube Channels:

1. **Yoga With Adriene**: Adriene offers a range of restorative yoga classes on her YouTube channel, including classes for relaxation, stress relief, and sleep.
2. **Restorative Yoga with Jillian Pransky**: Jillian is a experienced restorative yoga teacher who offers classes on her YouTube channel, including classes for beginners and more advanced practitioners.
3. **Dylan Werner Yoga**: Dylan offers a range of yoga classes, including restorative yoga classes that focus on relaxation, flexibility, and stress relief.

Other Resources:

1. **Restorative Yoga Institute**: The Restorative Yoga Institute offers online classes, workshops, and teacher training programs. They also have a free online class library that you can access with a subscription.
2. **Insight Timer**: Insight Timer is a meditation app that also offers a range of free yoga classes, including restorative yoga classes. They have a large library of classes, and you can filter by style, level, and duration.

Remember to always listen to your body and modify or come out of the pose if you experience any discomfort or pain. It's also a good idea to consult with a healthcare professional or yoga therapist before starting any new exercise routine.

I hope this helps you find some great online restorative yoga resources!
